clinical_study.brief_title: Alternative Treatments in Acute Mountain Sickness
clinical_study.official_title: Can Osteopathy and Expiratory Resistance be Used in Prevention and/or Treatment of Acute Mountain Sickness ? a Randomized Controlled Field Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut de Formation et de Recherche en Médecine de Montagne

clinical_study.source: Institut de Formation et de Recherche en Médecine de Montagne

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this research is to support a hypothesis that osteopathic manual medicine (OMM) and / or a 10 cmH2O end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) could be used in the prevention of acute mountain sickness (AMS).
During altitude exposure, an exaggerated hypoxemia and the increase of intracranial pressure are both known to be major physipathological ways of AMS development.
The goal of the osteopathic protocol is to release tension on the circulatory structures directly related to cranial circulation and drainage. The main hypothesis is that it could lead to lower intracranial pressure and help reducing AMS signs. Furthermore the investigators would like to define a osteopathic score for individual AMS sensitivity, based on cranial bones mobility.
Several studies have shown that using PEEP at altitude (or hypoxia) increases SpO2. As for osteopathy protocol, the investigators would like to apply this experimental condition during real altitude exposure in a randomized controlled protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Lake Louise Score from baseline to altitude continuous exposure.
primary_outcome.time_frame: mesured and reported every hour during a 10 hours altitude exposure
primary_outcome.description: Signs of acute mountain sickness regarding its severity according the official Lake Louise Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in numeric scale of well being from baseline to altitude continuous exposure.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every hour during a 10 hours altitude exposure
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of general feeling on a scale from 0 (feeling as before ascent) to 10 (worst feeling)

arm_group.description: Sham PEEP and fake osteopathic protocol

intervention.intervention_name: Osteopathic protocol for improving drainage of LCS
intervention.description: Osteopathic intervention improving drainage of LCS and cerebral blood flow through opitmizing veinous circulation
Breathing through a 10 cmH2O expiratory resistance for 10 min every 2 hours during 10h at 3842m high

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- Experienced alpinist
- No previous acclimatization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heart failure, respiratory failure, kidney failure
- Pregnant woman
